  1. Choose your base: Aim for ~30â€¯g protein within an hour of waking. Try 2 eggs with sautÃ©ed spinach, or a scoop of plant protein blended with almond milk and oats for a vegan option.
  2. Add anti-inflammatory color: Include berries, kiwi, or a handful of greens. Their antioxidants buffer lingering stress chemistry still clearing from your system.

  • Early wins: More stable energy before lunch, fewer midâ€‘morning sugar cravings, and slightly calmer scalp shedding within two weeks.

week3.practice3_html:
What it is

Katelynn, youâ€™re in the stabilization phaseâ€”your shedding waves are finally easing after that long injury period earlier this year. Right now, your follicles are repairing, and omegaâ€‘3s act like a soothing oil change for your scalp. Since you only eat fatty fish once or twice a month, this is your â€œbig dominoâ€: bringing in more good fats now will help lock down the calm that lets regrowth begin by spring.

Step-by-step implementation

  1. Include one rich omegaâ€‘3 food at least four times this week â€” salmon, sardines, mackerel, or trout. If you prefer plant options, add a tablespoon of ground flaxseed or chia daily.
  2. When using a supplement, check freshness: no â€œfishy burp,â€ and store capsules away from light and heat to avoid rancidity.
  3. Pair omegaâ€‘3s with colorful vegetables or a squeeze of lemon â€” antioxidants keep the fats working cleanly in your system.
